meanings.definition: A black mineral consisting of iron oxide.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a piece of magnetite during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: Miners extracted magnetite from the earth for industrial use.
meanings.sent3: The magnetite in the rock seemed to attract all the other minerals around it.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were drawn to the magnetite in the soil, like a magnetic force pulling her in.
meanings.sent5: The magnetite sparkled in the sunlight, a dark gem in the rough terrain.

meanings.sent1: The compass needle pointed north due to the magnetite in the rock.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the properties of magnetite to understand its magnetic behavior.
meanings.sent3: The magnetite in the mountain played tricks on the explorers' compasses.
meanings.sent4: His personality had a magnetite quality, drawing people towards him effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The magnetite in the cave walls hummed with an unseen energy, guiding the lost travelers.
